channel.title: BBC News - World
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Biden orders employees of big businesses to be vaccinated or face testing
item.description: The US president is using his executive power to require that big companies vaccinate employees.

item.title: Afghanistan: First foreigners fly out of Kabul since US pull-out
item.description: Dozens of people, including 13 UK citizens, take a plane from Kabul to Qatar's capital Doha.

item.title: Afghanistan: Journalists tell of beatings by Taliban
item.description: Reporter Taqi Daryabi tells the BBC he was kicked in the face and beaten with sticks by Taliban fighters.

item.title: Biden administration sues Texas over restrictive abortion law
item.description: The Texas law effectively bans abortions from as early as six weeks into a pregnancy.

item.title: Hong Kong: Police raid Tiananmen Square museum
item.description: The raid comes a day after four members of the group that ran the venue were arrested.

item.title: Austria man kept dead mother in cellar for pension, police say
item.description: The suspect is said to have "mummified" the corpse in order to continue receiving her pension.

item.title: Top US court halts Texas execution of inmate seeking pastor's touch
item.description: The inmate, convicted of murder, is calling for the right to have a pastor's hands on him as he dies.

item.title: Surfside tower collapse: Three arrested over victim ID thefts
item.description: The suspects are said to have purchased luxury items on illegally obtained credit cards.

item.title: North Macedonia: Deadly fire guts Covid hospital
item.description: Fourteen people are killed at a makeshift hospital treating Covid-19 patients in Tetovo.

item.title: North Korea: Military parade features hazmat suits, gas masks
item.description: Their inclusion may be a sign that a special force was created to prevent the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccines in South Africa: Free football tickets for fans with jabs
item.description: The government is concerned about growing anti-vaccine sentiment in the country.

item.title: Afghanistan: A new order begins under the Taliban's governance
item.description: The Taliban's new ministers have taken office - but are they any different this time around?

item.title: Inspirational Afghan robotics team begin new chapter
item.description: The BBC speaks to the women's robotics team about their ordeal trying to leave Afghanistan.

item.title: ‘Havana syndrome ’ and the mystery of the microwaves
item.description: The BBC investigates a mystery illness dubbed "Havana syndrome" that has affected American diplomats and spies.

item.title: Respect: Jennifer Hudson on embodying soul legend Aretha Franklin
item.description: The singer was personally selected by soul legend Franklin to play her in the new biopic Respect.

item.title: How a monkey launched the pop-it toy craze
item.description: Why it took a TikTok primate to turn a forty-year-old idea into a global hit

item.title: Why people in Eswatini are protesting
item.description: Eswatini is Africa’s last absolute monarchy, which means the king controls everything.

item.title: The Kenyans who are helping the world to cheat
item.description: Some Kenyans try to escape poverty by helping foreign students to fake their academic work.

item.title: The rare Indian swimming camels under threat
item.description: India's unique Kharai camels can swim in the sea. But their habitat is slowly disappearing.

item.title: Hoaxes, myths and conspiracies: How the internet distorted 9/11
item.description: Days after the attacks on 11 September 2001, the internet was rife with fake claims of what happened.

item.title: US: Colorado City will pay $3m to a woman with dementia injured by police
item.description: Bodycam footage shows the moment Colorado City officers detained and injured 75-year-old Karen Garner.

item.title: Lebanon: A country plunged into darkness
item.description: Lebanon’s ongoing crisis has plunged the country into darkness, with some experiencing power cuts for 20 hours a day.

item.title: Mexico earthquake: Lights seen in sky during tremor near Acapulco
item.description: The magnitude-seven quake struck the country's Pacific coast, near the resort of Acapulco.

item.title: Afghan Special Forces commander faced race against time to flee
item.description: An Afghan Special Forces commander says he owes his life to members of the Parachute Regiment who helped him escape.

item.title: Afghanistan: Could Pakistani drones hit the Panjshir Valley?
item.description: There are claims that Pakistan has used drones against anti-Taliban forces in Afghanistan.

item.title: Afghanistan: Women beaten for demanding their rights
item.description: Women in Afghanistan demanding their rights say they have been beaten by the Taliban.

item.title: Australia may cancel Afghan match if women banned
item.description: Cricket Australia (CA) will cancel its men's Test match with Afghanistan if reports that the women's team cannot play under Taliban rule are true.
